member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.BarSize.Paranormal
member.summary: Extreme big or paranormal bar is a bar with a significant length several times bigger than average bar

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.VolumeSize.Reduced
member.summary: 2 times smaller volume than the average volume for the last 12 bars

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.VolumeSize.Increased
member.summary: 2 times bigger volume than the average volume for the last 12 bars

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.CandleType.Doji
member.summary: opens and closes at the same price with bi-directional price fluctuation

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.CandleType.Gravestone
member.summary: open and close at the same price with upper price fluctuation

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.CandleType.Dragonfly
member.summary: open and close at the same price with down price fluctuation

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.CandleType.Whirligig
member.summary: High - Open = Close - Low or High - Close = Open - Low with short body

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.CandleType.HangingMan
member.summary: ohlc.High == ohlc.Open and ohlc.Close - ohlc.Low > body * 2

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.CandleType.InverseHammer
member.summary: ohlc.Low == ohlc.Open and ohlc.High - ohlc.Close > body * 2

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.CandleType.ShootingStar
member.summary: ohlc.Low == ohlc.Close and ohlc.High - ohlc.Open > body * 2

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Bars.Color
member.summary: Represents a 2 color + neutral (none) enum Used to color MA/BB and other simply indicating bearish/bullish direction with a color

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.FuturesOrderType
member.summary: Order type for a futures order

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.FuturesOrderType.Limit
member.summary: Limit orders will be placed at a specific price. If the price isn't available in the order book for that asset the order will be added in the order book for someone to fill.

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.FuturesOrderType.Market
member.summary: Market order will be placed without a price. The order will be executed at the best price available at that time in the order book.

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.FuturesOrderType.Stop
member.summary: Stop order. Execute a limit order when price reaches a specific Stop price

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.FuturesOrderType.StopMarket
member.summary: Stop market order. Execute a market order when price reaches a specific Stop price

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.FuturesOrderType.TakeProfit
member.summary: Take profit order. Will execute a limit order when the price rises above a price to sell and therefor take a profit

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.FuturesOrderType.TakeProfitMarket
member.summary: Take profit market order. Will execute a market order when the price rises above a price to sell and therefor take a profit

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.FuturesOrderType.TrailingStopMarket
member.summary: A trailing stop order will execute an order when the price drops below a certain percentage from its all time high since the order was activated

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.PositionSide
member.summary:
Position mode 1. One-way mode [DEFAULT] - you can only hold positions in one direction under one contract. Opening positions in both directions would cancel one another out or reduce their sizes.
2. Hedge mode - you can simultaneously hold positions in both long and short directions under the same contract. If you open long position on higher TF, but anticipate that in short term the price will move down, you want to open a short position as well
member.remarks: Hedge mode is a trading strategy used by futures traders to mitigate their risk exposure to the market. It involves opening two opposite positions, a long and a short, to profit from any market movement while minimizing potential losses.

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.PositionSide.Both
member.summary: In ONE-WAY mode they return BOTH i.e. you can identify the actual long/short direction by amount sign

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.Direction
member.summary: clearly defines position direction SHORT / LONG

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.Direction.None
member.summary: Undefined means position amount is 0 On practice the exchange will close current position, and open a new one with the next trade But for testing purposes it's easier to track one position instead of multiple small ones

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.Futures.WorkingType
member.summary: Type of working Stop price is triggered by: "MARK_PRICE" or "CONTRACT_PRICE". Default "CONTRACT_PRICE")
member.remarks: MARK PRICE refers to an estimated true value of a contract, it takes into consideration the fair value of an asset to prevent unnecessary liquidations during a volatile market Calculated as an average of the Last Price and the underlying asset’s Spot Price to avoid price manipulation of a single order book or exchange. (проливы и пампы и даже тыки цены на минутке все равно стопы рвёт так что сглаживание ну такое себе, хотя может потому что by default is Contract price)

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.OrderCondition.BuyIfAskRise
member.summary: когда мы собираемся войти в рынок в long как только будет преодолена трендовая линия но текущая цена ниже чем та по которой мы хотим купить к примеру текущая цена 400$ а мы ждем пока преодолеем уровень 500$ и только тогда затариваемся в лонг

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.OrderCondition.SellIfBidFall
member.summary: когда мы собираемся войти в рынок в short при падении ниже трендовой линии но текущая цена пока выше и не понятно будет ли дальнейшее снижение например: текущая цена 500$ а мы ждем падения ниже линии до 400$ только тогда открываем шорт

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.OrderType.LimitMaker
member.summary: Maker or "post-only" order is a conditional limit order, that serves to add liquidity to the order book so it is charged with a maker fee. If order price crosses market spread the order will be rejected.

member.summary: Get candle length in % formula: (High - Low)/Close * 100

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.BarLengthExtensions.GetBodyLength(AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Abstractions.IOhlc,System.Int32)
member.summary: get abs candle body length in %

member.summary: for bullish candles return upper shadow, for bearish - lower

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.BarLengthExtensions.HasLongShadow(AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Abstractions.IOhlc,System.Int32)
member.summary: long shadow means bar length is a times bigger than body length

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.BarLengthExtensions.GetBarSize(AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Abstractions.IOhlc,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Estimate bar size based on avg bar length

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.BarLengthExtensions.GetBarSizeAbs(AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Abstractions.IOhlc,AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.TimeFrame,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Estimate absolute bar size based on a timeframe and assumption that roughly avg bar size on H1 ~1.75% (1.5%-2% for big cap markets like BTC/ETH/TRX etc.) Thus we can omit avg bar length calculation, hence the absolute size as it is estimated comparatively to absolute mean

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.DecimalExtensions.Deduct(System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: deducts specified percent from the value e.g. commission 0.25%, buy 100 xrp in real you will get 100-0.25% = 99.75 xrp

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.TimeFrameExtensions.CalcBarCount(AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.TimeFrame,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate bar count = period / (int)timeframe i.e. how many bars (count) cover the specified period

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.TimeFrameExtensions.GetVolatilityByTimeFrame(AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Enums.TimeFrame)
member.summary: Volatility is kind of average* bar length at a given scale (timeframe) *average calculated taking into account only normal-size bars, similar princip as for ATR (short, long and paranormal bars are ignored as they are unusual) e.g.. tf:D ~7-8%, tf:H1 ~ 1.2-1.8% for some assets it could differ but in most cases ATR bar will

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.FormatNumberExtensions.FormatPrices(System.Double[],System.String)
member.summary: format numbers to string using n.FormatPrice() leading zeros will be replaced by replacement (e.g. 0.0001234 => 0..1234)

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Extensions.NumberExtensions.GetLeastExpDiff(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines the lowest exp for the value so the value*10^exp. > n

member.summary: compare prices if price difference is tiny returns true (about the same), otherwise false when tolerance is not provided, comparison relies on price meaningful digits

member.param: how many bullish bars should be in a row

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Helpers.TradingPairHelper
member.summary: helps to generate trading pairs (aka symbols) combining quote and base currencies

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Helpers.TradingPairHelper.CombineAll(System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: combines all quote assets with all base assets e.g. ["USDT","BUSD"] + ["BTC","XRP"] => ["BTC_USDT","BTC_BUSD", "XRP_USDT","XRP_BUSD"]

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Helpers.TradingPairHelper.CombineWithQuoteAssets(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: combines base asset with quote asset(s) e.g. "BTC" + ["USDT","BUSD"] => ["BTC_USDT","BTC_BUSD"]

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Helpers.TradingPairHelper.Combine(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: combine with e.g. USDT + [BTC,ETH,XRP] => [BTC_USDT, ETH_USDT, XRP_USDT]

member.name: P:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Models.Balance.BalanceBook.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of currencies in balance book

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Models.Balance.BalanceBook.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Can parse BalanceBook from strings like "0.2 BTC;10 USD; 25 TRX;0.05 ETH"

member.name: P:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Prices.PriceHelper.Prices
member.summary: these are indicative prices for purposes like ranking coins by value relative to other coins indicative means for example BTC is ~10 times bigger than ETH or ~100 times bigger than BCH, LTC etc.

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Symbols.SymbolDescriptor
member.summary: descriptors should help to classify coin-zoo

member.name: P:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Symbols.SymbolDescriptor.Markets
member.summary: what exchanges have trading pairs with this symbol possible values - `*` - widely accepted listed on many exchanges e.g. LTC - `Binance+` - listed on Binance and other markets - `Binance!` - listed on Binance but not listed on other big markets usually new listings on Binance - `Gate` - listed on gate.io i.e. not listed on Binance - `DEX` - listed on DEX only

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.CurrencyPair
member.summary: in `BTC_USDT`, BTC is a base currency, USDT is a quote currency

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.CurrencyValue
member.summary: Represents values like 10.00 UAH, 2.2 XRP etc.

member.name: T:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern
member.summary: Represents a symbol pattern which could be on of 7 pattern types e.g. `*`, `USD*`, `FIAT` (means fiat currencies), `ETH`, `*_ETH`, `ETH_*`, `BTC_USDT,ETH_USDT`, `ETH_USDT` SymbolPattern is designed to filter/match symbol(s)

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern.TOP_COINS
member.summary: BTC* means BTC + ETH,BNB,TRX etc. i.e. any TOP symbol that might serve as a quote symbol in trading pairs

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern.STABLECOIN
member.summary: USDT* means USDT + USDC,BUSD,USDJ,USDD,TUSD,VAI,DAI etc. i.e. any stable or pegged coin

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern.MatchAny(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: if any match found returns true, otherwise false

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern.MatchLiteral(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: match given symbol with one of literals (, etc.) returns true if matches, otherwise - false

member.name: M:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern.From(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Creates a symbol pattern Takes symbols apply filter if any symbol(s) are dropped than it combines rest of symbols into comma-separated symbols pattern, otherwise return symbol as is

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern.PatternType.Asset
member.summary: e.g.`ETH` means any pair with ETH as a base or quote asset

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern.PatternType.QuoteAsset
member.summary: *_USDT means any pair quoted to USDT

member.name: F:AVS.CoreLib.Trading.Types.SymbolPattern.PatternType.BaseAsset
member.summary: ATOM_* means any pair with ATOM as a base asset
